choices.D: Change the native VLAN on the ports.

discussion.content:

Got some giants in the logs due to differences in MTU between the two switches.

Type help or Type '?'
Look at the arp table and cross reference data?
show interfaces

How are yall figuring out which PC is connected to what port, any time i have taken this there is 5+ connections to the access switch. Cant seem to figure out how to differentiate the others except the one core port
Passed my exam yesterday, this pbq was there with different IPs

type "help" in the core switch and you will receive the commands.
Ask and thy shall receive :)
show mac-address table and show arp would be good, compare to the answers pregiven like PC1 and refer to the address table it pretty much tells you the answer to the questions
Looks like I'll have to post response in sections.
Huh. show mac-address-table is an old Cisco command. Surprised they haven't gone to show mac address-table. I suppose maybe they have super old switches in the scenario.

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION -

A network technician was recently onboarded to a company. A manager has tasked the technician with documenting the network and has provided the technician with partial information from previous documentation.


INSTRUCTIONS -

Click on each switch to perform a network discovery by entering commands into the terminal. Type help to view a list of available commands.
Fill in the missing information using the drop-down menus provided.
If at any time you would like to bring back the initial state of the simulation, please click the Reset All button.
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Tracert shows the exact route that packets take from source to destination, including all intermediate routers and network links

Selected Answer: A
A. Netstat - (short for "network statistics") displays detailed information about the active network connections and the routing tables. By using this tool, the technician can see which connections are active, their corresponding IP addresses, and the network interface being used.

Selected Answer: D
D. tracert (also traceroute) 

A command-line utility used to follow the path a packet takes between two hosts.

questions.question_text: A network technician is troubleshooting a web application's poor performance. The office has two internet links that share the traffic load. Which of the following tools should the technician use to determine which link is being used for the web application?
Which of the following types of routes will take precedence when building a routing table for a given subnet?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The static routes take precedence because they have the lowest administrative distance:
Connected Interface: (0) - Directly connected networks are always preferred.
Static Route: (0 or 1)
EIGRP Summary Route: (5)
External BGP (eBGP): (20)
EIGRP (Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol): (90)
IGRP (Interior Gateway Routing Protocol): (100) - Obsolete
OSPF (Open Shortest Path First): (110)
IS-IS (Intermediate System to Intermediate System): (115)
RIP (Routing Information Protocol): (120)
EIGRP External Route: (170)
Internal BGP (iBGP): (200)
Unknown: (255) - Unreachable routes

Selected Answer: A
A static route typically takes precedence when building a routing table because it usually has a lower administrative distance (AD) compared to dynamically learned routes
the router considers it a more reliable source of information and will use it first when choosing a path to a destination network; by default, static routes have an AD of 1, which is lower than most dynamic routing protocols, effectively prioritizing them in the routing table.

questions.question_text: Which of the following steps in the troubleshooting methodology comes after using a top-to-bottom examination of the OSI model to determine cause?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Top to bottom involves analyzing each layer of the network model to identify the potential source of the problem and creating a theory. So then next step would be to test the theory

Selected Answer: B
Using a top-to-bottom examination of the OSI model to determine the cause of the issue happens during the "Test the theory to determine cause" step. So, the next step is to establish a plan of action. Why are the other options incorrect?
- Test the theory: You've already tested the theory (using the OSI model examination) and determined the cause.
- Verify full system functionality: This is a later step, after you've implemented a solution.
- Identify the problem: This is the first step, which has already been completed.

This one pisses me off. The CompTIA troubleshooting methodology references to the OSI is to vague! This is why these exams are predatory.

I would Select. B
Comptia references by checking the OSI-model during ''3. Test the Theory''
What comes after Test the Theory?
''Establish a plan of action'' So... the right answer is: B: Establish a plan of action.

Reference: https://www.comptia.org/blog/troubleshooting-methodology

Selected Answer: A
You should be able to establish a theory using the OSI model, that is its intended use after all. Test the theory is next.

Selected Answer: A
The steps are: 
1. Identify the problem
2. Establish a theory of probable cause
3. Test the theory
4. Implement a solution or escalate
5. Verify functionality
6. Document findings

After step 2 we move on to 3, "test the theory". A is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: A
Correct answer is A because, examination of the OSI Model simply means "Establish a Theory of Probable Cause" according to Comptia, indicating the next step to be test the theory

Selected Answer: D
Test the Theory --------- comes in as the 3rd step of the Troubleshooting mdel and I believe, after examining the top-to-Bottom of the OSI. We should start with step 1..........ID the Problem

Selected Answer: D
my understanding is that after top-to-bottom examination, NO problem ID has been made yet.So,.....1st step of Troubleshooting Model is, "Identify the Problem"

Selected Answer: B
Establish a plan of action.
